column1: Santa Quitéria is a municipality in the central area of the state of Ceará
column2: Brazil. Its history goes back to the 18th Century
column3: when the farmer João Pinto de Mesquita settled in the area.

column1: The former farm Cascavel was elevated to the condition of Vila on August 27
column2: 1856 under the name of Santa Quitéria. Only on December 20
column3: 1938 Santa Quitéria was elevated to the category of city.

column1: It is the largest municipality of Ceará in terms of area.
